pr_title: Update Docs for native-image Commons Logging

timeline.bodyText: Hello @oztimpower, Should users be mentioning these versions here? Or does our bom file for Quarkus manage these versions? I think it's better to not have these versions specified here.
timeline.author: jaikiran
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -251,6 +251,48 @@ test {
 
 See also: <<getting-started-testing.adoc#test-from-ide,Running `@QuarkusTest` from an IDE>>
 
+
+[[logging-native-image]]
+== Logging with native image
+
+If you are using libraries that have dependencies on `Apache Commons Logging` and experience complications building the native image such as class not found, you can resolve this by integrating the `JBoss Logging` dependecy.
+
+The error seen when building native-image:
+```
+Caused by java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.commons.logging.impl.LogFactoryImpl)
+```
+
+Resolve by adding the associated `JBoss Logging` dependency:
+[source, xml]
+----
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.jboss.logging</groupId>
+            <artifactId>commons-logging-jboss-logging</artifactId>
+            <version>1.0.0.Final</version>

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            If you are using libraries that have dependencies on `Apache Commons Logging` and experience complications building the native image such as class not found, you can resolve this by integrating the `JBoss Logging` dependecy.
          
          
            
            If you are using libraries that have dependencies on `Apache Commons Logging` and are experiencing complications building the native image due to missing logging classes, you can resolve this by integrating the `JBoss Logging` dependency.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            If you are using dependencies that require `Apache Commons Logging` and experience a `ClassNotFoundException` when building the native-image, you can resolve this by adding the `JBoss Loggging` implementation.

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -396,3 +396,9 @@ Using such a construct means that a `-H:DynamicProxyConfigurationResources` opti
 ====
 For more information about Proxy Classes you can read https://github.com/oracle/graal/blob/master/substratevm/DYNAMIC_PROXY.md[the GraalVM documentation].

+
+=== Logging with Native Image
+
+If you are using dependencies that require `Apache Commons Logging` and experience a `ClassNotFoundException` when building the native-image, you can resolve this by adding the `JBoss Loggging` implementation.
